result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen Carlyle Henderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business Monday 3/7/22
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall participate in counseling or programming as recommended by his supervising agent.

The defendant shall comply with court orders issued in case 21CV82
The defendant shall have no abusive contact with LH as allowed in case 21CV82.
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen Carlyle Henderson

records.addlTxt:
09:01 AM Defendant Stephen Carlyle Henderson in court with attorney Blake Gross.  Lynne K Van Hollen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. 22CM4,21CM73-  21CM73-- Def was on a DEJ agreement, here on a motion to vacate agreement. Agreement in both cases as in the offer to settle. Ct finds the def know and vol waives right to be present in the court room. 
21CM73- the def does to contest the motion to vacate the DEJ agreement. DEJ is now vacated. State complied with Vic rights. 22CM4- PLEADS NC in 22CM4. Signed PLQ, understands elements. Ct accepts pleas, factual basis in the compl, finds the def G. State comments on sentencing. Atty comments on setencing. Def makes statements to the court. 
Ct orders- See offer to settle, attached.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

22cm4- rec'd compl, waives reading, stands mute, NG entered. Will not oppose DEJ motion. State comments on bail/bond. Atty comments on bail/bond
Ct orders-- $500 sign bond and comply with all Ct orders-- sign by 4pm today  Motion hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
